gurmukhi: ਮਾਗਧ ਮਹੀਪ ਮੰਡੇ ਮਹਾਨ || ਦਸ ਚਾਰ ਵਿਦਯਾ ਨਿਧਾਨ || ਬੰਗੀ ਕੁਲਿੰਗ ਅੰਗੀ ਅਜੀਤ || ਮੋਰੰਗ ਅੱਗ੍ਰ ਨੈਪਾਲ ਅਭੀਤ ||੫੦੮||
transliteration: Maagadh Maheep Mande Mahaan|| Das Chaar Chaar Vidyaa Nidhaan|| Banianiajit|| Moran Aggra Naipaal Abheet||508||
translation: There he met the kings of Magadha, who were experts in eighteen sciences; on that side there were also fearless kings of Bang, Kaling, Nepal etc.508.

gurmukhi: ਛੱਜਾਦ ਕਰਣ ੲਿੱਕਾਦ ਪਾਵ || ਮਾਰੇ ਮਹੀਪ ਕਰ ਕੈ ੳੁਪਾਵ || ਖੰਡੇ ਅਖੰਡ ਜੋਧਾ ਦੁਰੰਤ || ਲਿੱਨੋ ਛਿਨਾੲਿ ਪੂਰਬ ਧਰੰਤ ||੫੦੯||
transliteration: Chhajjaad Karan Ikkaad Paav|| Mdare Maheep Kar Kai Oupaav|| Khande Akhannddjokhaa Durant|| Linno Chhinaae Poorab Dharant||509||
translation: Many kings who were equal in authority like Yaksha, were killed by adopting suitable measures and in this way, cruel warriors were killed and the land of the East was also snatched.509.

gurmukhi: ਦਿੱਨੋ ਨਿਕਾਰ ਰਾਛਸ ਦ੍ਰੁਬੁੱਧ || ਕਿੱਨੋ ਪਯਾਨ ੳੁੱਤਰ ਸਕ੍ਰੁੱਧ || ਮੰਡੇ ਮਹੀਪ ਮਾਵਾਸ ਥਾਨ || ਖੰਡੇ ਅਖੰਡ ਖੂਨੀ ਖੂਰਾਨ ||੫੧੦||
transliteration: Dinno Nikaar Raachhas Droubuddh|| Kinno Payaan Outtar Skruddh|| Mande Maheep Maavaas Thaan|| Khande Akhannddkhoonikhuraan||510||
translation: The demons of evil intellect were killed and turned towards the North in great anger and after killing many dangerous kings, bestowed their kingdom on others.510.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤਿ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਬਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਟਕੇ ਕਲਕੀਵਤਾਰੇ ਪੂਰਬ ਜੀਤ ਬਿਜਯ ਨਾਮ ਸਮਾਪਤ ਧਯਾਯ ਤੀਜਾ ||੩||
transliteration: It(i) Sri Bachitra Naatke Kalkeevatdare Poorab Jeet Bijay Naam Samaapat Dhyaay Teejaa||3||
translation: End of the Chapter third entitled “Victory over the East” in Kalki incarmnation in Bachittar Natak.3.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਭਾਂਤ ਪੂਰਬ ਪੱਟਨ ੳੁਪੱਟ || ਖੰਡੇ ਅਖੰਡ ਕੱਟੇ ਅਕੱਟ || ਫੱਟੇ ਅਫੱਟ ਖੰਡੇ ਅਖੰਡ || ਬੱਜੇ ਨਿਸ਼ਾਨ ਮਚਿਓ ਘਮੰਡ ||੫੧੧||
transliteration: Eh Bhaant Poorab Pattan Oupatt|| Khande Akhannddkatte Akatt|| Phatte Aphatt Khande Akhannd|| Bajje Nishaan Machio Ghamannd||511||
translation: (Now begins the description of the twenty-fourth of the cities of the east and Killing the fighters of indestructible Glory the trumpets of Kalki incarnation sounded proudly.511.

gurmukhi: ਜੋਰੇ ਸੁਜੰਗ ਜੋਧਾ ਜੁਝਾਰ || ਜੋ ਤਜੇ ਬਾਣ ਗੱਜਤ ਲੁਝਾਰ || ਭਾਜੰਤ ਭੀਰ ਭਹਰੰਤ ਭਾੲਿ || ਭਭਕੰਤ ਘਾੲਿ ਡਿੱਗੇ ਅਘਾੲਿ ||੫੧੨||
transliteration: Jore Sujan Jadhaa Jujhaar|| Jo Taje Baan Gadjat Lujhaar|| Bhaajant Bheer Bhahrant Bhaae|| Bhabhkant Ghaae Digge Aghaae||512||
translation: The warriors were again absorbed in war and showered arrows while thundering; the cowards ran away in fear and their wounds burst.512.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਜੰਤ ਸਾਜ ਬਾਜਤ ਤੁਫੰਗ || ਨਾਚੰਤ ਭੂਤ ਭੈ ਧਰ ਸੁਰੰਗ || ਬਬਕੰਤ ਬਿਤਾਲ ਕਹਕੰਤ ਕਾਲ || ਡਮਕੰਤ ਡੳੁਰ ਮੁਕਤੰਤ ਜ੍ਵਾਲ ||੫੧੩||
transliteration: Saajant Saaj Baajat Touphan|| Naachannd Bhoot Bhai Dhat Suran|| Babkant Bidaal Kahkant Kaal|| Damkant Daur Mouktant Jvaal||513||
translation: The warriors were bedecked; the war-drums sounded, the ghosts danced in a charming manner, the Baitals shouted the goddess Kali laughed and the fire-showering tabor was played.513.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਜੰਤ ਭੀਰ ਤਜ ਬੀਰ ਖੇਤ || ਨਾਚੰਤ ਭੂਤ ਬੈਤਾਲ ਪ੍ਰੇਤ || ਕ੍ਰੀੜਤ ੲੀਸ ਪੋਅੰਤ ਕਪਾਲ || ਨਿਰ ਖੰਤ ਬੀਰ ਛਕਿ ਬਰਤ ਬਾਲ ||੫੧੪||
transliteration: Bhaajant Bheer Taj Beer Khet|| Naachannd Bhoot Baitaal Pret|| Kreedat Ees Poant Kapaal|| Nir Khatt Beer Chhak(i) Barat Baal||514||
translation: The cowards ran away from the battlefield; the ghosts, fiends and Baitals danced; the Shiva, engaged in Sport, began to string the rosaries of skulls and the warriors looking at the heavenly damsels covetously, wedded them.514.

gurmukhi: ਧਾਵੰਤ ਬੀਰ ਬਾਹੰਤ ਘਾਵ || ਨਾਚੰਤ ਭੂਤ ਗਾਵੰਤ ਚਾਵ || ਡਮਕੰਤ ਡੳੁਰ ਨਾਚੰਤ ੲੀਸ || ਰੀਝਤ ਹਿਮਿੰਦ੍ਰ ਪੋਅੰਤ ਸੀਸ ||੫੧੫||
transliteration: Dhaavant Beer Baahant Ghaav|| Naachannd Bhoot Gadvant Chaav|| Damkant Daur Naachannd Ees|| Reejhat Himindra Poant Sees||515||
translation: The warriors, inflicting wounds are falling upon the opponents and the ghosts are dancing and singing with zeal; Shiva is dancing while playing on his tabor.515.

gurmukhi: ਗੰਧ੍ਰੱਬ ਸਿੱਧ ਚਾਰਣ ਪ੍ਰਸਿੱਧ || ਕਥੰਤ ਕਾਬ ਸੋਭੰਤ ਸਿੱਧ || ਗਾਵੰਤ ਬੀਨ ਬੀਨਾ ਬਜੰਤ || ਰੀਝੰਤ ਦੇਵ ਮੁਨ ਮਨ ਡੁਲੰਤ ||੫੧੬||
transliteration: Gaddhrabb Siddh Chaaran Prasiddh|| Kathant Kaab Sobhant Siddh|| Gadvant Been Beenaa Bajant|| Rijhant Dev Mounndman Dulant||516||
translation: The famous Gandharvas, the minstrels and adepts are composing poems in appreciation of war; the gods playing their lyres, are pleasing the mind of sages.516.

gurmukhi: ਗੁੰਜਤ ਗਜਿੰਦ੍ਰ ਹੈਵਰ ਅਸੰਖ || ਬੁੱਲਤ ਸੁਬਾਹ ਮਾਰੂ ਬਜੰਤ || ੳੁਠੰਤ ਨਾਦ ਪੂਰਤ ਦਿਸਾਣ || ਡੁੱਲਤ ਮਹੇਂਦ੍ਰ ਮਹਿ ਧਰਮ ਹਾਣ ||੫੧੭||
transliteration: Gadjat Gadindra Haivar Asankh|| Bullat Soubaah Maroo Bajant|| Outhant Naad Poorat Disaan|| Dullat Mahendra Maih Dharma Haan||517||
translation: There is sound of innumerable elephants and horses and the drums of war are being played; the sound is spreading in all the directions and the Sheshnaga is wavering on felling the loss of Dharma.517.

gurmukhi: ਖੁੱਲੰਤ ਖੇਤ ਖੂਨੀ ਖਤੰਗ || ਛੁੱਟੰਤ ਬਾਣ ਜੁੱਟੇ ਨਿਸ਼ੰਗ || ਭਿੱਦੰਤ ਮਰਮ ਜੁੱਝਤ ਸੁਬਾਰ || ਘੁੰਮੰਤ ਗੈਣ ਅੱਛ੍ਰੀ ੳੁਛਾਹ ||੫੧੮||
transliteration: Khullant Khet Khoonikhatan|| Chhouttant Baan Joutte Nishan|| Bhiddant Maram Jujjhat Sabaah|| Ghounmant Gadn Achchhri Ouchhaad||518||
translation: The bloody swords have been drawn in the battlefield and the arrows are being discharged fearlessly; the warriors are fighting and their secret parts are touching each other; the heavenly damsels are roaming in the sky enthusiastically.518.

gurmukhi: ਸਰਖੰਤ ਸੇਲ ਬਰਖੰਤ ਬਾਣ || ਹਰਖੰਤ ਹੂਰ ਪਰਖੰਤ ਜੁਅਾਣ || ਬਾਜੰਤ ਢੋਰ ਡੳੁਰੂ ਕਰਾਲ || ਨਾਚੰਤ ਭੂਤ ਭੈਰੋ ਕਪਾਲ ||੫੧੯||
transliteration: Sarkhannd Sel Barkhannd Baan|| Harkhannd Hoor Parkhannd Juaan|| Baajant Dhor Dauroo Karaal|| Naachannd Bhoot Bhairo Kapaal||519||
translation: There are showers of lances and arrows and seeing the warriors, the heavenly damsels are getting pleased; the drums and dreadful tabors are being and the ghosts and Bhairavas are dancing.519.
